For any commutative semiring R and multiset s of type R, the k-th coefficient of the polynomial product of X + Œª over Œª in s equals the (cardinality of s - k)-th elementary symmetric function of s, provided that k is less than or equal to the cardinality of s.

name: Multiset.prod_X_add_C_coeff
docString: For any commutative semiring R and multiset s of type R, the k-th coefficient of the polynomial product of X + Œª over Œª in s equals the (cardinality of s - k)-th elementary symmetric function of s, provided that k is less than or equal to the cardinality of s.

This theorem states that, for any index type `Œπ`, any function `f` from `Œπ` to the extended nonnegative real numbers (`ENNReal`), and any extended nonnegative real number `a`, the product of `a` and the indexed supremum (`iSup`) of `f` is equal to the supremum (denoted by `‚®Ü i`) of `a` times `f i` across all `i` in `Œπ`. In other words, multiplication distributes over the supremum in the extended nonnegative real numbers.

type: ‚àÄ {Œπ : Sort u_4} {f : Œπ ‚Üí ENNReal} {a : ENNReal}, a * iSup f = ‚®Ü i, a * f i
name: ENNReal.mul_iSup
docString: This theorem states that, for any index type `Œπ`, any function `f` from `Œπ` to the extended nonnegative real numbers (`ENNReal`), and any extended nonnegative real number `a`, the product of `a` and the indexed supremum (`iSup`) of `f` is equal to the supremum (denoted by `‚®Ü i`) of `a` times `f i` across all `i` in `Œπ`. In other words, multiplication distributes over the supremum in the extended nonnegative real numbers.

docString:
Shows that

For two monovarying functions `f` and `g` over a finite set `s`, the product of their sums obeys the inequality $|s| \cdot \sum_{i \in s} f(i)g(i) \geq \left(\sum_{i \in s} f(i)\right) \cdot \left(\sum_{i \in s} g(i)\right)$.

type:
‚àÄ {Œπ : Type u_1} {Œ± : Type u_2} [inst : LinearOrderedRing Œ±] {s : Finset Œπ} {f g : Œπ ‚Üí Œ±},
  MonovaryOn f g ‚Üës ‚Üí ((s.sum fun i => f i) * s.sum fun i => g i) ‚â§ ‚Üës.card * s.sum fun i => f i * g i
name: MonovaryOn.sum_mul_sum_le_card_mul_sum
docString: For two monovarying functions `f` and `g` over a finite set `s`, the product of their sums obeys the inequality $|s| \cdot \sum_{i \in s} f(i)g(i) \geq \left(\sum_{i \in s} f(i)\right) \cdot \left(\sum_{i \in s} g(i)\right)$.

This theorem states that for a finite set `s` of some type `Œ±` and an element `a` of type `Œ±` that is not in `s`, along with a function `f` from `Œ±` to another type `M` with a commutative monoid structure, the total product of `f(i)` for each `i` in the set obtained by inserting `a` into `s` equals the product of `f(a)` and the total product of `f(i)` for each `i` in `s`. In mathematical notation, this can be written as \(\prod_{i \in s \cup \{a\}} f(i) = f(a) \prod_{i \in s} f(i)\), assuming that the product is defined as `1` for an empty set.

type:
‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {M : Type u_5} [inst : CommMonoid M] {a : Œ±} {s : Set Œ±} (f : Œ± ‚Üí M),
  a ‚àâ s ‚Üí s.Finite ‚Üí (finprod fun i => finprod fun h => f i) = f a * finprod fun i => finprod fun h => f i
name: finprod_mem_insert
docString: This theorem states that for a finite set `s` of some type `Œ±` and an element `a` of type `Œ±` that is not in `s`, along with a function `f` from `Œ±` to another type `M` with a commutative monoid structure, the total product of `f(i)` for each `i` in the set obtained by inserting `a` into `s` equals the product of `f(a)` and the total product of `f(i)` for each `i` in `s`. In mathematical notation, this can be written as \(\prod_{i \in s \cup \{a\}} f(i) = f(a) \prod_{i \in s} f(i)\), assuming that the product is defined as `1` for an empty set.

Consider a series of functions `‚àë' i, f i x`. Assume that each individual function `f i` is of
class `C^N`, and moreover there is a uniform summable upper bound on the `k`-th derivative
for each `k ‚â§ N`. Then the series is also `C^N`.

  (‚àÄ (i : Œ±), ContDiff ùïú N (f i)) ‚Üí
    (‚àÄ (k : ‚Ñï), ‚Üëk ‚â§ N ‚Üí Summable (v k)) ‚Üí
      (‚àÄ (k : ‚Ñï) (i : Œ±) (x : E), ‚Üëk ‚â§ N ‚Üí ‚ÄñiteratedFDeriv ùïú k (f i) x‚Äñ ‚â§ v k i) ‚Üí
        ContDiff ùïú N fun x => ‚àë' (i : Œ±), f i x

Given a (completely) multiplicative function `f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí F`, where `F` is a normed field,
such that `‚Äñf p‚Äñ < 1` for all primes `p`, we can express the sum of `f n` over all `N`-smooth
positive integers `n` as a product of `(1 - f p)‚Åª¬π` over the primes `p < N`. At the same time,
we show that the sum involved converges absolutely.

type:
‚àÄ {F : Type u_1} [inst : NormedField F] [inst_1 : CompleteSpace F] {f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí* F},

    ‚àÄ (N : ‚Ñï),
      (Summable fun m => ‚Äñf ‚Üëm‚Äñ) ‚àß HasSum (fun m => f ‚Üëm) (Finset.prod (Nat.primesBelow N) fun p => (1 - f p)‚Åª¬π)
name: EulerProduct.summable_and_hasSum_smoothNumbers_prod_primesBelow_geometric
docString:
Given a (completely) multiplicative function `f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí F`, where `F` is a normed field,

positive integers `n` as a product of `(1 - f p)‚Åª¬π` over the primes `p < N`. At the same time,
we show that the sum involved converges absolutely.

The second element of a product $\prod_{i=0}^n (r_i + m_i)$ is a sum of terms of the form
$r_0\cdots r_{i-1}m_ir_{i+1}\cdots r_n$.

type:
‚àÄ {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst_1 : AddCommMonoid M] [inst_2 : Module R M]
  [inst_3 : Module R·µê·µí·µñ M] [inst_4 : SMulCommClass R R·µê·µí·µñ M] (l : List (TrivSqZeroExt R M)),
  TrivSqZeroExt.snd (List.prod l) =
    List.sum
      (List.map
        (fun x =>
          List.prod (List.take x.1 (List.map TrivSqZeroExt.fst l)) ‚Ä¢
            MulOpposite.op (List.prod (List.drop (Nat.succ x.1) (List.map TrivSqZeroExt.fst l))) ‚Ä¢
              TrivSqZeroExt.snd x.2)
        (List.enum l))
name: TrivSqZeroExt.snd_list_prod
docString:
The second element of a product $\prod_{i=0}^n (r_i + m_i)$ is a sum of terms of the form
$r_0\cdots r_{i-1}m_ir_{i+1}\cdots r_n$.
